item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: A Database Written in Golang (44 points | 14 comments)
2. The FFT Strikes Back: An Efficient Alternative to Self-Attention (243 points | 87 comments)
3. Show HN: Breakout with a roguelite/vampire survivor twist (39 points | 19 comments)

5. Long division verified via Hoare logic (3 points | discuss)
6. The Miserable State of Modems and Mobile Network Operators (43 points | 9 comments)
7. Telescope – an open-source web-based log viewer for logs stored in ClickHouse (128 points | 42 comments)
8. I Went to SQL Injection Court (1029 points | 378 comments)
9. DeepGEMM: clean and efficient FP8 GEMM kernels with fine-grained scaling (357 points | 61 comments)
10. Online discussions on forests preserved in the Finnish Web Archive (20 points | 1 comment)
11. Material Theme has been pulled from VS Code's marketplace (365 points | 268 comments)
12. Hyperspace (774 points | 400 comments)
13. Part two of Grant Sanderson's video with Terry Tao on the cosmic distance ladder (334 points | 65 comments)
14. State of emergency declared after blackout plunges most of Chile into darkness (118 points | 85 comments)
15. Ask HN: Who Are Your Favorite Photography and Generative Coding Artists? (13 points | 6 comments)

17. Ggwave: Tiny Data-over-Sound Library (240 points | 56 comments)
18. A New Proposal for How Mind Emerges from Matter (33 points | 19 comments)
19. A CLI to quickly launch VSCode/cursor devcontainers (27 points | 8 comments)
20. The journalists training AI models for Meta and OpenAI (55 points | 23 comments)
21. Hard problems that reduce to document ranking (294 points | 40 comments)
22. The Deep Research problem (263 points | 107 comments)
23. Why are QR Codes with capital letters smaller than QR codes with lower case? (277 points | 81 comments)
24. Iterated Log Coding (79 points | 25 comments)
25. Bald eagles are thriving again after near extinction (263 points | 177 comments)
26. Automattic Hit with Class Action over WP Engine Dispute (58 points | 10 comments)
27. Modernist Cuisine: The Art and Science of Cooking (108 points | 88 comments)
28. Embedding Python in Elixir, it's fine (298 points | 60 comments)
29. Evaluating modular RAG with reasoning models (55 points | 22 comments)
30. Chicory: A JVM native WebAssembly runtime (190 points | 91 comments)
